page.title: 18FARMING
page.content: This is one of the largest in the parish, although not all the land lies within the parish boundary. In total there are 500 acres,of which 300 are arable, producing mostly barley,with wheat and oil-seed rape and in the last 2 years peas as a protein crop. The rough grassland is used for store cattle and ponies, while the remaining 140 acres is woodland,producing some fencing materialsand in the last 2 seasons a pheasant shhot has been started on a syndicated basis with some 2000 birds being bought in for release. The owner is Keith Broadstock, and he and one full-time worker run the farm with the help of casual workers during the busy seasons of harvest and planting.
